tweet: Too many victims of sexual assault never get the justice they deserve. That’s why @RepMaloney & I are introducing the Debbie Smith Reauthorization Act, which will reduce the DNA evidence backlog to swiftly identify & arrest violent predators. https://wagner.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/wagner-maloney-introduce-bill-to-renew-dna-testing-grant-program …

I will continue to advocate for fundamental human rights, & use this opportunity step up our fight against human trafficking, an injustice that has enslaved over 40 million innocent people worldwide. https://wagner.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/wagner-named-vice-ranking-member-of-house-foreign-affairs-committee …

I’m excited to take on this challenge as Vice Ranking Member of @HouseForeignGOP & apply my foreign policy experience to strengthen partnerships & alliances, advance the U.S.-led international order, & confront adversaries when necessary.
Read my full press release here: https://wagner.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/house-passes-wagner-legislation-combating-sex-and-drug-trafficking …

I am thrilled to announce the House passed the FIND Trafficking Act last night. This legislation will better reveal how traffickers are hiding from law enforcement & abusing victims. https://youtu.be/cM5mSkz4bMo

We will never forget the horror of the Holocaust, nor its many victims. #HolocaustRemembranceDay

I'm honored & humbled that Congressman @PatrickMcHenry has asked me to serve as his Vice Ranking Member of @FinancialCmte. See our full statement here: https://wagner.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/wagner-named-vice-ranking-member-of-house-financial-services-committee …

Our nation’s public servants have a duty to call people to their greatest & best, not to their lowest & least. Congrats to AJ Woodman, the first #MO2 class of 2023 academy nominee to receive an appointment! I was thrilled to give AJ the news & know he will excel @WestPoint_USMA! pic.twitter.com/SlqS5LoqEr
I had the chance to meet with Grace and two members of the STL Gals for Gals, Shannon & Chloe. I admire their passion to serve and to protect the most vulnerable in our society.

I am always inspired by young students like Grace who founded STL Gals for Gals, an anti-human trafficking advocacy group. Over a short period of time, Grace has garnered dozens of members & enormous support for her work to raise awareness & fight trafficking around the world. pic.twitter.com/kO1JxAO3Og
It’s a privilege to assist my constituents, and I’m grateful to do something that means so much for Mike and his family and that honors his father’s legacy of service.

Two weeks ago, Mike asked for assistance obtaining a copy of his late father’s military records. This week, I presented him with a copy of the service medals his father earned during WWII. pic.twitter.com/s5wlSYe41T
Unemployment numbers are at a historic low in St. Charles County, & the Job Center is doing great work assisting incumbent workers and placing skilled workers with job opportunities across the area.

Assisting our workforce by giving opportunities & technical training is vital to the success of our economy. Joined by St. Charles County Executive Steve Ehlmann, we discussed workforce development efforts at the federal, state, & local levels at the MO Job Center of St. Charles. pic.twitter.com/SNeKqkc0Jp

Heard about the valuable work our @ofallonpolice Department is doing while visiting the state-of-the-art O’Fallon Justice Center with Mayor Bill Hennessy. Always proud of our men and women in blue who sacrifice so much to protect our community each day. pic.twitter.com/AdwXZi30N3
Life is beautiful, and children are a blessing. I will always stand with those who support life. pic.twitter.com/Jt9wYJUGjO

We must put partisanship aside, secure our border, and reopen the government. My colleagues on both sides of the aisle should come to the table so we can find a solution and make sure federal workers get paid for the work they are doing and the work they have done. pic.twitter.com/QX5u4XPpUX

For #ReligiousFreedomDay, we remember that America has long been a beacon of freedom, both in thought and practice. Our founding principles reflect the invaluable quest for truth and importance of free thinking and expression—ideals we still hold self-evident today.
Thank you to all those who will march for life this week. I stand with you, & I will continue to fight & pray for the day when abortion is not only illegal, but unthinkable.

I #MarchForLife b/c life is beautiful, children are a blessing, & we must do all we can to support mothers. There is so much bipartisan work we can do to protect America’s mothers & babies. I hope we can act together to serve & protect all God’s children. https://youtu.be/82WCbq7OLvE

Always great to meet with Kevin Malone and Geoff Rogers with @USIAHT1 to find new ways to battle human trafficking. They have been strong partners and I look forward to continuing to work with them as we advance our goal of eradicating modern day slavery. pic.twitter.com/PTcmrdn2zV

Proud to team up w/@RepJuanVargas to introduce the Fight Illicit Networks & Detect (FIND) Trafficking Act. To learn more about how this helps root out traffickers who are anonymously transferring money & hiding their crimes from the public eye, click here: https://wagner.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/wagner-and-vargas-introduce-important-legislation-to-combat-sex-and-drug …

Today is #NationalLawEnforcementAppreciationDay and we honor the men and women who put their lives on the line every day to keep us safe. Our families and neighborhoods are safer thanks to their sacrifices and we are grateful for their dedicated service. pic.twitter.com/qoQVgOFPRJ

I enjoyed meeting w/ Indian-American constituents from Saint Louis this week. Our Indian-American community has contributed greatly to Missouri’s 2nd District & I am proud to work w/ constituents who are so invested in making our District a better place to live & raise a family. pic.twitter.com/m1ZGEEW3V7
(7/7) I voted no today on the rules package because the people of Missouri deserve fairness and this rules package neither embodies that, nor does it make life better for my constituents.
(6/7) This package also eliminates commonsense pro-life provisions that have long held broad support and protect the life of the unborn.

(5/7) It shouldn’t be easy to take more of your hard earned money and send it to Washington – it should be harder. 2nd District families are burdened enough by taxes, and the last thing Congress should be doing is making it easier to increase your taxes.
(4/7) One of the biggest partisan power grabs gives the Democratic majority the power to raise your taxes with only a simple majority, instead of the supermajority that was in place last Congress.

(3/7) That is why I am disappointed that Democrats decided to forgo bipartisanship on their first day in power when they forced through changes to the rules of the House of Representatives that will make life more difficult for our community.
(2/7) Whether it is my work to end human trafficking, supporting our veterans, or cutting the red tape that holds back American ingenuity, the needs of #MO2 come first.
(1/7) I am honored and privileged to work for you in Congress, and do my best to support bipartisan solutions to our nation’s most urgent problems.

to strengthen our community we can ensure that it remains one full of hope and opportunity for the future. I look forward to seeing you & your families back home in Missouri, & if you are visiting Washington, D.C., please visit our new office in room 2350 in the Rayburn Building.

Today I was sworn into the 116th Congress, where I look forward to keeping my promise of making life better for you and your families. Faithfully serving Missouri's 2nd District remains a top priority of mine in Congress. It is truly an honor to serve, and by working together... pic.twitter.com/brjpkHCUhe
Wishing you and your loved ones a #HappyNewYear and looking forward to another year serving the people of Missouri’s 2nd Congressional District!
